Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Compulsive \Com*pul"sive\, a. Having power to compel; exercising or applying compulsion. [1913 Webster]
Religion is . . . inconsistent with all compulsive motives. --Sharp. [1913 Webster]

compulsive adj 1: caused by or suggestive of psychological compulsion; "compulsive drinking" 2: strongly motivated to succeed [syn: {determined}, {driven}] n : a person with a compulsive disposition; someone who feels compelled to do certain things
